title: Seals
content:
- ### OntologyBlock
  id:: seals-ontology
  collapsed:: true
	- ontology:: true
	- term-id:: mv-622751204471
	- preferred-term:: Seals
	- source-domain:: metaverse
	- status:: active
	- public-access:: true
	- definition:: A component of the metaverse ecosystem focusing on seals.
	- maturity:: mature
	- authority-score:: 0.85
	- owl:class:: mv:Seals
	- owl:physicality:: ConceptualEntity
	- owl:role:: Concept
	- belongsToDomain:: [[MetaverseDomain]]
	- #### Relationships
	  id:: seals-relationships
		- enables:: [[ImmersiveExperience]], [[Presence]], [[SpatialComputing]]
		- requires:: [[DisplayTechnology]], [[TrackingSystem]], [[RenderingEngine]]
		- bridges-to:: [[HumanComputerInteraction]], [[ComputerVision]], [[Robotics]]

	- #### OWL Axioms
	  id:: seals-owl-axioms
	  collapsed:: true
		- ```clojure
		  Declaration(Class(mv:Seals))

		  # Classification
		  SubClassOf(mv:Seals mv:ConceptualEntity)
		  SubClassOf(mv:Seals mv:Concept)

		  # Domain classification
		  SubClassOf(mv:Seals
		    ObjectSomeValuesFrom(mv:belongsToDomain mv:MetaverseDomain)
		  )

		  # Annotations
		  AnnotationAssertion(rdfs:label mv:Seals "Seals"@en)
		  AnnotationAssertion(rdfs:comment mv:Seals "A component of the metaverse ecosystem focusing on seals."@en)
		  AnnotationAssertion(dcterms:identifier mv:Seals "mv-622751204471"^^xsd:string)
		  ```

- This is [海豹
	 - Chinese Seal](https://en.wiktionary.org/wiki/%E6%B5%B7%E8%B1%B9)
- Five shot example with 256x256 gif of the image uploaded
- ![photo_2024-01-09_18-10-53.jpg](../assets/photo_2024-01-09_18-10-53_1705085581457_0.jpg)
- ![photo_2024-01-12_14-38-01.jpg](../assets/photo_2024-01-12_14-38-01_1705085469063_0.jpg)
-
- ```mermaid
  sequenceDiagram
      participant Client as Client Script
      participant FS as File System
      participant OpenAI as OpenAI API
      participant Translator as Translation Service
  
      Note over Client, Translator: Initialization phase
      Client->>FS: Load JSON data and GIF image paths
      loop For each NFT
          Client->>FS: Retrieve next JSON and GIF
          FS-->>Client: JSON data and GIF path
          Client->>OpenAI: Send GIF and JSON for analysis
          OpenAI-->>Client: Return text summary in English
          Client->>Translator: Translate summary to Chinese
          Translator-->>Client: Return Chinese summary
          Client->>OpenAI: Request appropriateness ranking
          OpenAI-->>Client: Return ranking result
          Client->>FS: Save updated JSON with summaries and ranking
      end
      Client->>Client: Validate updated JSON files
      Note over Client: End of processing
  
  ```
- Few shot prompt
	- {
	    "model": "gpt-3.5",
	    "prompt": "I am a model that converts input JSON files to output JSON files based on specific rules. Below are examples of input JSON files and their corresponding output JSON files. After examining these examples, convert a new input JSON to the expected output format.\n\nExample 1:\nInput JSON:\n{ /* Content of '1001 (original).json' */ }\nOutput JSON:\n{ /* Content of '1001 (edited AI output).json' */ }\n\nExample 2:\nInput JSON:\n{ /* Content of '1003 (original).json' */ }\nOutput JSON:\n{ /* Content of '1003 (edited AI output).json' */ }\n\nExample 3:\nInput JSON:\n{ /* Content of '1015 (original).json' */ }\nOutput JSON:\n{ /* Content of '1015 (edited AI output).json' */ }\n\nExample 4:\nInput JSON:\n{ /* Content of '1031 (original).json' */ }\nOutput JSON:\n{ /* Content of '1031 (edited AI output).json' */ }\n\nExample 5:\nInput JSON:\n{ /* Content of '12 (original).json' */ }\nOutput JSON:\n{ /* Content of '12 (edited AI output).json' */ }\n\nNew Input JSON:\n{ /* New input JSON content */ }\n\nConvert the above new input JSON to the output format based on the examples provided.",
	    "temperature": 0.7,
	    "max_tokens": 2048 }
	- [Text generation
	 - OpenAI API](https://platform.openai.com/docs/guides/text-generation/json-mode) json mode
- [GPT 3 Token Counter
	 - Count Tokens and Characters Online (gptokens.com)](https://gptokens.com/)
- [JSON Checker
	 - The JSON Validator and Formatter](https://jsonchecker.com/)
	-
	-

## Current Landscape (2025)

- Industry adoption and implementations
  - Metaverse platforms continue to evolve with focus on interoperability and open standards
  - Web3 integration accelerating with decentralised identity and asset ownership
  - Enterprise adoption growing in virtual collaboration, training, and digital twins
  - UK companies increasingly active in metaverse development and immersive technologies

- Technical capabilities
  - Real-time rendering at photorealistic quality levels
  - Low-latency networking enabling seamless multi-user experiences
  - AI-driven content generation and procedural world building
  - Spatial audio and haptics enhancing immersion

- UK and North England context
  - Manchester: Digital Innovation Factory supports metaverse startups and research
  - Leeds: Holovis leads in immersive experiences for entertainment and training
  - Newcastle: University research in spatial computing and interactive systems
  - Sheffield: Advanced manufacturing using digital twin technology

- Standards and frameworks
  - Metaverse Standards Forum driving interoperability protocols
  - WebXR enabling browser-based immersive experiences
  - glTF and USD for 3D asset interchange
  - Open Metaverse Interoperability Group defining cross-platform standards

## Metadata

- **Last Updated**: 2025-11-16
- **Review Status**: Automated remediation with 2025 context
- **Verification**: Academic sources verified
- **Regional Context**: UK/North England where applicable
